shortdef: a building or room used for social amusements; specifically : one used for gambling
a card game in which cards are won by matching or combining cards in a hand with those exposed on the table

dt: hill 1706 feet (520 meters) high in southern Italy between Rome and Naples

Monte Cassino was the site of {d_link|St. Benedict of Nursia's|Benedict of Nursia:b} first monastery and the birthplace of the Benedictine Order. In the Battle of Monte Cassino in 1944, Allied forces suffered heavy casualties but eventually prevailed over the Axis defenders; Allied bombers destroyed the monastery, which was later rebuilt.

shortdef: hill 1706 feet (520 meters) high in southern Italy between Rome and Naples
